title: The Little Dog
content:
Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. He was a very playful and friendly dog. He loved to run and jump around, and he always had a wagging tail.

One day, Spot was playing in the park when he saw a group of children playing. He ran up to them and started barking happily. The children were so excited to see him. They petted him and gave him treats. Spot had a wonderful time playing with the children.

He made many new friends, and he learned that being friendly and kind can make you very happy.

title: The Brave Little Rabbit
content:
In a small forest, there lived a little rabbit named Pippin. He was a very timid rabbit, and he was always afraid of everything. He was afraid of the big trees, the dark shadows, and even the smallest noises.

One day, Pippin was playing in the meadow when he saw a group of older rabbits teasing a smaller rabbit. Pippin knew he had to do something to help. He took a deep breath and hopped over to the older rabbits. He stood up tall and told them to leave the smaller rabbit alone.

The older rabbits were surprised by Pippin's bravery, and they backed away. The little rabbit was so grateful to Pippin for saving him. He learned that even the smallest of us can be brave when we stand up for what is right.

title: The Ant and the Grasshopper
content:
Once upon a time, an ant worked hard all summer long, collecting and storing food for the winter. A grasshopper, on the other hand, spent the summer singing and dancing, enjoying a carefree life.

When winter came, the ant had plenty of food to eat, while the grasshopper was starving. The grasshopper begged the ant for food, but the ant refused. The ant said, 'You had all summer to prepare for winter, but you chose to sing and dance instead. Now you must face the consequences.'

This story teaches us the importance of hard work and preparation.

title: The Lion and the Mouse
content:
A lion was about to eat a mouse when the mouse begged for mercy. The lion laughed and let the mouse go. Later, the lion was caught in a hunter's net.

The mouse heard the lion's roar and came to help. The mouse gnawed through the ropes of the net, freeing the lion. The lion was grateful to the mouse for saving his life.

He learned that even the smallest creatures can be helpful. Size doesn't matter when it comes to friendship and kindness.

title: The Ugly Duckling
content:
Once upon a time, there was an ugly duckling. He was different from all the other ducklings, and they made fun of him. The ugly duckling was so unhappy that he ran away. He wandered around for a long time, feeling lonely and sad.

One day, he saw a flock of beautiful swans flying overhead. He longed to be like them, but he thought he was too ugly. The ugly duckling stayed by a lake for the winter. He watched the swans swimming and playing, and he dreamed of being able to join them.

One day, he looked down at his reflection in the water and saw that he was no longer an ugly duckling. He had become a beautiful swan. This teaches us that everyone has a unique beauty.

title: Doing as Mum Told
content:
Tom was seven years old, and he was going to school soon. He was a good boy, but he didn't like to get up early. He slept until nine or ten o'clock in the morning. His mother didn't want Tom to be late for school.

So she bought him an alarm clock. She said to Tom, 'You must get up when you hear the clock ring.' After that, Tom got up when he heard the clock ring at six thirty every morning.

One day, the clock didn't work. Tom didn't get up at six thirty. It was time for her to wake him up. Tom said to his mother, 'I woke up very early.' 'Then why didn't you get up?' Mother was angry. 'You told me that I must get up when I heard the clock ring. So I'm still waiting for the bell.' This funny story shows how children follow instructions literally!

title: Who You Are Makes a Difference
content:
One night a man came home to his 14-year-old son and sat him down. He said, 'The most incredible thing happened to me today. I was in my office and one of the junior executives came in and he told me that he admired me and gave me a blue ribbon for being creative genius. The blue ribbon that says "Who I am makes a difference".

Then he gave me an extra ribbon and asked me to find somebody else special to honor. As I was driving home tonight, I started thinking about whom I would honor with this ribbon and I thought about you. My days are really hectic, and when I come home, I don't pay a lot of attention to you. Sometimes I scream at you for not getting enough good grades in school and for your bedroom being a mess.

But somehow tonight, I just wanted to sit here and, well, just let you know that you do make a difference to me. Beside your mother, you are the most important person in my life. You're a great kid and I love you.' The startled boy started to sob and sob, and he couldn't stop crying. His whole body shook. He looked up at his father and said, through his broken tears, 'I was planning on committing suicide tomorrow, Dad, because I didn't think you loved me. Now I don't need to do that.' Love cures people â€“ both the ones who give it and the ones who receive it.
